website_summaries.verdict: A popular cast iron seasoning oil for good reason – it doesn't contain unnecessary ingredients. Comes in a handy spray bottle. Made by a top brand in cast iron cookware.
pros: Made by Lodge, a trusted manufacturer of cast iron products
Easy to use, as it comes in a convenient spray bottle with adjustable settings
Natural canola oil with no additives
cons: Some consumers gripe that it's pricey, considering it's canola oil
but many more customers are pleased with the applicator and results

customer_reviews.title: Hmm.... smoke point 400???
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of cast iron pans and in the past I had seasoned them with PAM high temp grill spray. My wife hated when I was baking the empty pans, because the smoke point of the PAM was obviously south of the 360 degree temp I was using, so it stunk up the entire house. This stuff claims a smoke point of 400 degrees - but despite scrubbing all remaining oil off of the pan and reconditioning, it still smoked in the oven and stunk up the entire house.... Don't know if there was any residual oil (not sure how) - but time will tell if this is actually any better for 2x the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is great. After cleaning just do a quick spray, rub it in evenly and heat to season.
customer_reviews.author: J Irey

customer_reviews.title: Great cast iron seasoning oil
customer_reviews.text: I love cast iron cooking, and this is a great way to season after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Gail D Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works Well if you continue to use it. Seasoning means only that it helps preserve the cast iron and make it virtually non stick. Prevents rust. We have used it for years and it is handier than Crisco and other oils as this is in a spray can.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wesch

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The fine spray works well without having way too much oil on the cast iron pans. The bonus is the lack of old oil smell that happens way too fast with vegetable oil

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for cast-iron cookware
customer_reviews.text: After learning about some of the not-so-great things associated with teflon and other chemical non-stick coatings, we have starting investing in cast-iron pots and pans. Our entire collection thus far consists of Lodge products. I tried using cooking oil for coating the pots and pans after cleaning but the oil was hard to spread and did not seem to be getting absorbed much. I decided to give this spray a try. The fine spray helps apply a light and even coat to the cookware, leaving less residue that needs to be wiped away. We have not cooked using this spray, so can't speak for it on that front.
customer_reviews.author: N S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this spray. It makes my cast iron look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Potratz

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.title: He's a great cook.

customer_reviews.title: 100% Canola oil in a can - that is it
customer_reviews.text: Actually it is me that deserves 1 star for NOT reading a referring article (thekitchn) adequately and then not reading the ingredient of this. It is canola oil, in a can. I have typically used canola oil ... a dribble and then wipe it around the pan. Sheesh. I am so humiliated that I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Summers

customer_reviews.title: If you have a cast iron pan you need this spray.
customer_reviews.text: This makes reoiling my cast iron pans (and my non-stick pans) much easier, although I always get the full stream. I don't see how to spray only a little of it, and I end up with a vertical line of spray. I had to get used to how far it sprayed above the nozzle, and I can't tell you how many times I've had to clean up the overspray until I got used to how wide the spray pattern is. But I still wouldn't go back to plain oil for anything.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Lodge Seasoning Spray (8 oz)
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. This is pure canola oil with no propellants or other ingredients. Perfect for seasoning your cast iron and also for cooking. I use it for both. Since it's pure canola, it can be used for traditional nonstick pans as well. This should be sold in every supermarket. Who doesn't have cast iron? By the way, it sprays wide so aim with care. ; )
customer_reviews.author: J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Caps on both - cant return
customer_reviews.text: I like the product and have purchased on Amazon previously, but I will not buy it again through Amazon. The caps on both were so damaged that i could not use it, I had to throw them out. It was obviously done during packing. Use the product, but DON'T BUY ON AMAZON is my suggestion. I tried to return, but they cant be returned.

customer_reviews.title: Great for seasoning.

It provides some nice maintenence between proper seasonings in the oven. Yes, you can just use some oil and a paper towel, but this device allows you to mist the coating all over and evenly before wiping down.

customer_reviews.title: Seasoning spray works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my lodge cast iron pan I also bought through Amazon. It's nice but I really don't see the point in it. I think using vegetable oil you already have home would be fine. It's nice that it's in spray form. So far it has worked well to maintain my pan. I say buy it if there is a good deal on it. Otherwise don't spend your money on it unless it's something you really want.
customer_reviews.author: MamaUnicorn

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like this spray, The only reason I gave it a 3 star and not a 5 is that it was a bit of a small can for the money. When you use it the way that I did the can did not last very long, If the can was bigger and lasted longer it would have gotten a 5 star.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: There is nothing special about this stuff and for Lodge to put their trustful name on it is a huge disappointment. Will think ab
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a total joke, it is 100% canola oil. Go to your local store and buy it for 78 cents a can. There is nothing special about this stuff and for Lodge to put their trustful name on it is a huge disappointment. Will think about ever buying anything from them again. I mean really? Canola oil at 10x the cost in stores? Thought there would be special seasonings or something as it does say seasoning spray. This is BS I want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Here we go again!

product_meta.title: Lodge Seasoning Spray, 8-Ounce ,Yellow
product_meta.description: Protect and enhance your cast iron cookware like Dutch ovens, skillets, griddles, grilling pans and platters with Lodge Seasoning Spray. Proper use and care of cast iron recommends using a thin layer of vegetable oil after cleaning. This non-aerosol spray has no additives or propellants and is helpful in replenishing the seasoning and preparing your cast iron treasure for it's next use. The more you use your cast iron, the better it gets and this seasoning spray simplifies the application of the seasoning oil. Made of 100% pure Canola, with adjustable spray settings. 8 fluid ounces.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: This item is available for shipping in the U.S. except for California and to select countries outside the U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
